folder: Clinton Street & Hamilton Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Clinton Street (right), west side, north from Hamilton Avenue, also shown is Hamilton Avenue (left) east side, north from Clinton Street.

P. L. Sperr

June 9, 1938.

folder: Clinton Street & Hamilton Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1)
Clinton Street, south from Hamilton Avenue and West 9th Street, showing where the Red Hook Houses--a New York City Housing Authority project--will be erected on the west side of the street (right).

June 9, 1938

P. L. Sperr

(2)
The east side of Clinton Street, viewing south from Hamilton Avenue, showing the changes that have taken place. The building in modernistic design, beyond the taxpayer, is the Clinton Theatre.

September 7, 1940

P. L. Sperr

folder: Clinton Street & Hamilton Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
text:

folder: Hamilton Avenue & Clinton Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Hamilton Avenue, south from Clinton Street. All the buildings on the thoroughfare, as far south as Third Avenue, will be razed and the avenue reconstructed into the northerly extension of the Belt Parkway. See "The New York Times," June 27, 1940, p. 4.

View 1: April 9, 1939
Views 2,3: July 24, 1940

P.L. Sperr

View 2: South from Mill Street.
View 3: South from Centre Street.

View 2: Neg. No. A-1037
View 3: Neg. No. A-1038

folder: Clinton Street & Hamilton Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Clinton Street, east side, north from Hamilton Avenue to Huntington Street. The buildings are being demolished for the widening of the avenue and its reconstruction into Gowanus Parkway, a link in the Belt Parkway system of highways.

September 7, 1940

P. L. Sperr

folder: Hamilton Avenue & Clinton Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Hamilton Avenue, east side, north from Clinton Street, showing extensive widening of the thoroughfare as part of the Belt Parkway system.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: September 7, 1940
View 2: July 24, 1940

View 2: shows Hamilton Avenue at Clinton Street.
view 2: Neg. No. A-1027
